Helpful documents will provide authoritative guidance from reputable health organizations, such as the CDC or WHO, on how to properly use bleach to disinfect surfaces to prevent the spread of COVID-19. These documents should include clear instructions on dilution ratios, application methods, and safety precautions to avoid harmful exposure. Additionally, they may discuss the efficacy of bleach against the virus and any relevant scientific studies supporting its use. Harmful documents, on the other hand, may contain misinformation or dangerous advice, such as ingesting bleach or using it in ways that pose health risks. They might also include unverified claims or pseudoscientific information that could lead to improper use or misunderstanding of bleach's role in combating COVID-19.
